intro.upper_desc_1: This board is Scanteq's hardware and firmware solution for complex real-time control systems, integrating a fast ARM microprocessor, a powerful FPGA (Field Programmable Logic Array), and specific peripherals. Plugin can be effectively used in a wide range of industrial equipment that requires high computing power, implementation of embedded hardware and firmware, and analog and digital interfaces to perform functions appropriate for various applications, such as:

data.descrizione: Direct torque or Space Vector motor control
Control systems for thermal and inkjet print heads

intro.lower_desc_1: The integration of Plugin technology allows our customers to focus on developing the specific behaviors of their application without wasting valuable time on developing and debugging a complex control board. Using this strategy, they not only increase the added value of the products and drastically reduce release time but also achieve a much lower development cost.

data.titolo: Fast ARM Microcontroller with Rich Peripherals
data.altSrc: Fast ARM Microcontroller with Rich Peripherals

dettagli.descrizione: After careful market study, Scanteq's engineers chose the NXP LPC4078FBD144 microcontroller as the core of the board. Its control unit is an ARM Cortex-M4 processor for embedded applications that require a high level of integration and low power dissipation.

The ARM Cortex-M4 processor offers a combination of high performance and low power consumption, making it ideal for a wide range of embedded applications. This choice allows Scanteq to guarantee a versatile and powerful platform for its customers.

The board design includes the use of an FPGA for complex control systems requiring configurable peripherals. Scanteq's engineers selected the Xilinx Spartan 6 FPGA for its system integration capabilities with the lowest cost for high-volume applications.

The Spartan 6 FPGA is known for its flexibility and ability to handle complex real-time tasks. This makes it particularly suitable for applications requiring a high degree of customization and execution speed.

The board is equipped with analog-digital converters, a temperature sensor, an accelerometer sensor, and many regulated switching power supplies to control complex equipment. These components allow real-time measurement of signals required by control algorithms.

The presence of various sensors and A/D converters ensures the necessary precision to efficiently monitor and control the hardware. The regulated switching power supplies ensure that all components receive a stable voltage, essential for the correct functioning of the board.

The board is designed to communicate with many peripherals via standard buses and interact with the operator in a user-friendly way. It includes Ethernet ports, USB, Micro-SD cards, RS232 and RS485 serial ports.

Additionally, the presence of a CAN, I2C, and SPI port allows versatile interaction with a wide range of external devices. This set of communication ports and buses makes the board extremely flexible and suitable for many industrial and control applications.
